intro: Parishella californica, commonly known as the California Parishella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. This perennial herb features slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal practices. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is typically found in coastal and inland regions of California.
